name: David Letterman
monologue: Yesterday, New York City Mayor Bloomberg got in on the Groundhog Day festivities. The mayor is so tiny. He saw the groundhog, threw a saddle on it and rode it up Fifth Ave.

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Reasons I'm Not On The Show Tonight presented by Paris Hilton

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Yesterday was Groundhog Day. In fact, when the groundhog came out of his hole, he didn’t even look for his shadow, he just said he was walking away from his mortgage.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Well, it happened again. Two Northwest pilots overshot Minneapolis Airport by 500 miles. They weren’t in a plane, they were in a Toyota. It wouldn’t stop.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: President Obama has announced his administration’s plan to build a new $8 billion high-speed rail system. Have you ever been on Amtrak? We can’t even figure out how to keep a low-speed rail system from crashing.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: ABC News reports that the president of Pakistan slaughters a goat every day since becoming president, in an attempt to ward off the “evil eye.” It’s good to see these modern, progressive people are our allies in the war against terror.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: During his town hall meeting in New Hampshire yesterday, President Obama said that using stimulus money to help schools is “not sexy” but it’s “making a difference.”  Oddly enough, that's the same way he describes Nancy Pelosi.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: At the town hall event, President Obama also said, “Jobs will be our No. 1 focus in 2010.” He then added, “Specifically, mine and Biden's jobs.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The president told Senate Democrats that politics "can't just be about scoring points." Then today, he was sued by the Knicks for stealing their motto.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Everyone’s talking about the military’s “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell” policy.  Adm. Mike Mullen said it’s wrong to force people “to lie about who they are” in order to serve their country.  Then Congress was like, “Who cares?  We do that every election.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: President Obama told a group of high school kids not to blow their college money in Las Vegas and people in Las Vegas are very upset. Without these kids’ college funds, who is going to take care of the ventriloquists and the prostitutes?

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Rahm Emanuel, who used an extremely offensive word to describe liberal democrats, apologized today to the head of the Special Olympics and to Snooki from “Jersey Shore.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Adm. Michael Mullen, the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, says he believes gays should serve in the military. All gays, whether they want to or not.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Iran fired a rocket into space carrying a mouse, a turtle, and some worms. It reminds me of the time when I was eight years old and my friend and I glued a cockroach to a bottle rocket and shot it over his fence.
